Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: Draw a basic plant shape (student can replicate simple features like stems and leaves).
CANNOT: Correctly depict the effect of water on plant health (e.g., showing a plant as healthy with or without water; student may not understand the role of water).
Show the impact of light on plant growth (e.g., both sunny and dark plants look the same; student misunderstands the importance of light).
Clearly represent differences between plants with and without essential resources (student might draw all plants as similar, regardless of conditions).
Illustrate concepts like wilting or thriving accurately (student might not know what these terms look like visually).
Demonstrate the need for both water and light for plants to grow in their drawings (student might show only one element or none as important).
